intro: Lomaria articulata, commonly known as the jointed lomaria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Lomaria articulata is often found in moist, shaded environments and is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes.
